sailpoint.api

Class ScopeService

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.api.ScopeService

  • public class ScopeService
extends java.lang.Object
    Service to deal with scopes. While the Scoper is more aimed at scope services as they relate to identities, this provides methods to deal with scopes from a more interactive perspective.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ScopeService.DeletionOptions
      DeletionOptions provide information about what to do with scope references when a scope is deleted.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public void save(Scope scope)
          throws GeneralException
        This does the some necessary processing to correctly save a scope. This commits the transaction.
        Parameters:
        scope - The scope to save
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • moveScope

        public void moveScope(Scope toMove,
                      Scope oldParent,
                      Scope newParent)
               throws GeneralException
        Move the given scope from being a child of the oldParent to the newParent.
        Parameters:
        toMove - The Scope to move.
        oldParent - The previous parent of the scope being moved (null if toMove was a root scope).
        newParent - The new parent of the scope (null if toMove is to become a root scope).
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • deleteScope

        public void deleteScope(Scope scope,
                        ScopeService.DeletionOptions options)
                 throws GeneralException
        Delete the given scope using the given DeletionOptions to clean up references.
        Parameters:
        scope - The Scope to delete.
        options - Options that describe how to deal with references to this scope.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • queueDirtyScope

        public void queueDirtyScope(Scope scope,
                            boolean commit)
                     throws GeneralException
        Queue this scope as a dirty scope. Note - this commits the transaction.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • terminateDenormalization

        public void terminateDenormalization()
        Terminate the scope denormalization process when we get to a good stopping point.

      • denormalizePaths

        public int denormalizePaths()
                     throws GeneralException
        If there are any scope changes that affect the denormalized paths on SailPointObjects, push these out to all objects.
        Returns:
        The number of scopes that were denormalized.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • getAssignedScopeFilter

        @Deprecated
public Filter getAssignedScopeFilter(Identity user)
                                          throws GeneralException
        Deprecated. Use ScopeService.getAssignedScopeQueryInfo(Identity) instead
        Generates a Filter to find objects in the specified user's assigned scope
        Parameters:
        user - Identity whose assigned scope is being applied
        Returns:
        Filter that finds objects in the specified user's assigned scope or null if scoping is disabled
        Throws:
        GeneralException

        Returns:

        Generates a Filter to find objects in the specified user's controlled scopes
        Parameters:

      • isScopingEnabled

        public boolean isScopingEnabled()
        Convenience method for determining whether or not scoping is enabled on this system
        Returns:

      • isUnscopedGloballyAccessible

        public boolean isUnscopedGloballyAccessible()

      • hasAssignedScope

        public boolean hasAssignedScope(java.lang.Class<? extends SailPointObject> clazz)
                         throws GeneralException
        Convenience method for determining whether a given class supports scopes
        Parameters:
        clazz - A class that extends SailPointObject
        Returns:
        true if the class supports scopes; false otherwise
        Throws:
        GeneralException - when the class cannot be instantiated (ideally, never)
